intro: Clethra dombeyi, commonly known as the dwarf sweet pepper, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of white, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and thrives in partial to full shade. Its small, elliptical leaves and showy blooms make it a desirable ornamental plant. Clethra dombeyi is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
